title: AMD may get across the CUDA moat
Thread-per-core
dot:
digraph RustAsyncControversy{rankdir=LR;node[shape=box, style=filled, fillcolor="#f9f9f9", fontname="Helvetica"];controversy[label="Rust Async Controversy", shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#e0e0e0"];multi_threaded[label="Multi-Threaded Executors
(Work-Stealing)", fillcolor="#cce5ff"];thread_per_core[label="Thread-Per-Core Architecture", fillcolor="#cce5ff"];performance[label="Performance Considerations", fillcolor="#cce5ff"];tradeoffs[label="Trade-offs
(Work-Stealing vs Share-Nothing)", fillcolor="#cce5ff"];claims[label="Claims of Melodrama
'Original Sin of Rust async programming...'", fillcolor="#fff3cd"];work_stealing[label="Work-Stealing Mechanism
Balances work among threads", fillcolor="#fff3cd"];tail_latency[label="Improves Tail Latency", fillcolor="#fff3cd"];state_safety[label="Requires State to be Thread-Safe
`Send` bounds", fillcolor="#fff3cd"];benefits[label="Benefits of Thread-Per-Core
Simplicity & Performance", fillcolor="#fff3cd"];share_nothing[label="Share-Nothing Architecture
Avoids synchronization costs", fillcolor="#fff3cd"];implementation[label="Complex Implementation for
Transactional Consistency", fillcolor="#fff3cd"]; controversy->multi_threaded;controversy->thread_per_core;multi_threaded->claims;multi_threaded->work_stealing;multi_threaded->tail_latency;multi_threaded->state_safety; thread_per_core->benefits;thread_per_core->share_nothing;thread_per_core->implementation;multi_threaded->tradeoffs;thread_per_core->tradeoffs; tradeoffs->performance[label="Impacts CPU Utilization"];tradeoffs->state_safety[label="Synchronization Costs vs Cache Performance"];}
